sen.j: 不退寺（ふたいじ）は、奈良市法蓮町にある真言律宗の寺院。
sen.e: Futai-ji Temple is located in Horen-cho, Nara City and belongs to Shingon Ritsu sect.
Futai-ji Temple is located in Horen-cho, Nara City and belongs to Shingon Ritsu sect.
Futai-ji Temple is located in Horen-cho, Nara City and belongs to Shingon Ritsu sect.

sen.j: 本尊は聖観音（業平観音とも呼ばれる）。
sen.e: The principal image is Sho Kannon (also known as Narihira Kannon).
The principal image is Sho Kannon (also known as Narihira Kannon).
The principal image is Sho Kannon (also known as Narihira Kannon).

sen.j: 山号は金龍山。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Kinryuzan.
Its sango (lprefix of a Buddhist temple)is Kinryu-zan.
sen.cmt: (prefix of a Buddhist temple) is Kinryu-zan.としました。
sen.e: Its sango (lprefix of a Buddhist temple)is Kinryu-zan.

sen.j: 寺号は詳しくは不退転法輪寺と称する。
sen.e: The formal temple name is Futaiten Horin-ji Temple.
The formal temple name is Futaiten Horin-ji Temple.
The formal temple name is Futaiten Horin-ji Temple.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 仁明天皇の勅願を受け、在原業平が開基したとの由緒から「業平寺」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: Since the temple was founded by ARIWARA no Narihira at the imperial order by the Emperor Ninmyo, it is also called the 'Narihira-dera Temple.'
Since the temple was founded by ARIWARA no Narihira at the imperial order by the Emperor Ninmyo, it is also called the 'Narihira-dera Temple.'
Since the temple was founded by ARIWARA no Narihira at the imperial order by the Emperor Ninmyo, it is also called the 'Narihira-dera Temple.'

sen.j: 奈良市街北部に位置し、南方を関西本線が斜めによぎる。
sen.e: It is located in the northern area of Nara City, and the Kansai Main Line goes diagonally to the south of the temple.
It is located in the northern area of Nara City, and the Kansai Main Line goes diagonally through the south side of the temple.
sen.cmt: through the south side of the temple.としました。
sen.e: It is located in the northern area of Nara City, and the Kansai Main Line goes diagonally through the south side of the temple.

sen.j: 境内には四季折々、レンギョウ、ツバキ、カキツバタ、キクなどが咲き乱れ、晩秋にはカエデ、ナンテンなどが見られる。
sen.e: In the precincts, many seasonal flowers bloom such as weeping forsythia, camellia, Japanese iris and chrysanthemum, and at the end of autumn, people can enjoy maple trees and nandin.

In the precincts, various flowers, such as weeping forsythia, camellia, Japanese iris and chrysanthemum, bloom from season to season, and in late autumn people can enjoy the charming colors of maple leaves and nandin berries.
sen.cmt: various flowers, such as weeping forsythia....and chrysanthemum, bloom from season to season...in late autumn people can enjoy the charming colors of maple leaves and nandin berries.
sen.e: In the precincts, various flowers, such as weeping forsythia, camellia, Japanese iris and chrysanthemum, bloom from season to season, and in late autumn people can enjoy the charming colors of maple leaves and nandin berries.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 寺伝によれば、大同 (日本)4年（809年）、平城天皇が譲位してのち隠棲し「萱の御所」と称したのが始まりとされる。
sen.e: According to the temple legend, the history started in 809, when Emperor Heizei abdicated the throne and lived in seclusion at this place, which was named 'Kaya no Gosho (Thatched-Roofed Imperial Palace).'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the temple legend, the origin goes back to 809, when Emperor Heizei abdicated the throne and started to live in seclusion at this place, naming it 'Kaya no Gosho (Thatched-Roofed Imperial Palace).'
sen.cmt: 訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: According to the temple legend, the origin goes back to 809, when Emperor Heizei abdicated the throne and started to live in seclusion at this place, naming it 'Kaya no Gosho (Thatched-Roofed Imperial Palace).'

sen.j: その後平城天皇の皇子である阿保親王、更に阿保親王の5男である在原業平が暮らしたという。
sen.e: Following that, the Imperial Prince Abo, a son of the Emperor Heizei, and ARIWARA no Narihira, the fifth son of the Imperial Prince Abo also lived there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Afterwards, it is said that the Imperial Prince Abo, a son of the Emperor Heizei, and ARIWARA no Narihira, the fifth son of the Imperial Prince Abo, also lived there.
sen.cmt: Afterwards, it is said that を加えました。
sen.e: Afterwards, it is said that the Imperial Prince Abo, the son of the Emperor Heizei, and ARIWARA no Narihira, the fifth son of the Imperial Prince Abo, also lived there.

sen.j: 伊勢神宮参詣時に受けた神勅を機に、業平が自ら聖観音像を刻み、「不退転法輪寺」と号して阿保親王の菩提を弔った。
sen.e: According to the oracle Narihira received when he visited the Ise-jingu Shrine, he himself carved the statue of Sho Kannon, named this temple 'Futaiten Horin-ji Temple' and prayed to Buddha for the happiness of the dead Imperial Prince Abo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Upon the oracle that Narihira received when he visited the Ise-jingu Shrine, he himself carved the statue of Sho Kannon, and prayed to Buddha for the consolation of the soul of dead Imperial Prince Abo at this palace, giving it the name of 'Futaiten Horin-ji Temple.'
sen.cmt: 訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Upon the oracle that Narihira received when he visited the Ise-jingu Shrine, he himself carved the statue of Sho Kannon, and prayed to Buddha for the consolation of the soul of dead Imperial Prince Abo at this palace, giving it the name of 'Futaiten Horin-ji Temple.'

sen.j: これが寺院としての始まりと伝えられている。
sen.e: This was the start of this place as a temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This was the beginning of this place as a temple.
This was the beginning of this place as a temple.

sen.j: 寺の近辺からは平安時代前期の古瓦が出土しており、創建がその頃までさかのぼることは認められる。
sen.e: Since old roof-tiles were excavated around this temple, the establishment seems to date back to the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since old roof-tiles were excavated around this temple, the establishment can be dated back to the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: seems to date→ can be dated
sen.e: Since old roof-tiles were excavated around this temple, the establishment can be dated back to the early Heian period.

sen.j: だが、中世以前の沿革はあまり明らかでない。
sen.e: However, the history before the medieval period is not quite sure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the history before the medieval times is not quite sure.
However, the history before the medieval times is not quite sure.

sen.j: 境内
sen.e: The precincts
The precincts
The precincts

sen.j: 南門－鎌倉時代末期、正和6年（1317年）の建立で、切妻造・本瓦葺。
sen.e: The south gate –established in 1317 at the end of Kamakura period and the style is Kirizuma-zukuri (an architectural style with a gabled roof) and hongawarabuki (roof with formal tiles).
The south gate –constructed in 1317 at the end of Kamakura period and the style is Kirizuma-zukuri (an architectural style with a gabled roof) and hongawarabuki (formal tile roofing).
sen.cmt: established→constructed(roof with formal tiles) →(formal tile roofing)
sen.e: The south gate –constructed in 1317 at the end of Kamakura period and the style is Kirizuma-zukuri (an architectural style with a gabled roof) and hongawarabuki (formal tile roofing).

sen.j: 冠木上には笈形調の装飾が見られる。
sen.e: On Kabuki (the upper crossbar which connects the both-sides pole of a gate), oigata decoration (a scriptural decoration) can be seen.
On Kabuki (the upper crossbar which connects the both-sides pole of a gate), oigata shape decoration (a scriptural decoration) can be seen.
sen.cmt: 笈形調の装飾：oigata decoration (a scriptural decoration)
sen.e: On Kabuki (the upper crossbar which connects the both-sides pole of a gate), oigata shape decoration (a scriptural decoration) can be seen.

sen.j: 1934年（昭和9年）の修理時、多くの墨書銘が確認された。
sen.e: At the restoration in 1934, many bokushomei (ink inscriptions) were found.
At the restoration in 1934, many bokushomei (ink inscriptions) were found.
At the restoration in 1934, many bokushomei (ink inscriptions) were found.

sen.j: 本堂－室町時代前期の建立。
sen.e: Hondo (main hall) – established in early Muromachi period
Hondo (main hall) – constructed in early Muromachi period
Hondo (main hall) – constructed in early Muromachi period

sen.j: 寄棟造・本瓦葺。
sen.e: The style is yosemune-zukuri (hipped roof) style and hongawarabuki.
It is a yosemune-zukuri (hipped roof) style structure with hongawarabuki tile roofing.
sen.cmt: 寄棟造は建築スタイル、本瓦葺は屋根の葺き方なので修正しました。
sen.e: It is a yosemune-zukuri (hipped roof) style structure with hongawarabuki tile roofing.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代に入ってから一般化した、正面中央に虹梁を配する様式の初見例とされる。
sen.e: This is the first example of a building whose façade is decorated with Koryo (a moderately carved beam like a rainbow), which style became popular as late as in Kamakura period.
This is the first example of the architectural structures whose facade is decorated with Koryo (a moderately carved beam like a rainbow), the style that became popular in Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: the first example of the architectural structures whose facade is...like a rainbow), the style that became popular in Kamakura period.
sen.e: This is the first example of the architectural structures whose facade is decorated with Koryo (a moderately carved beam like a rainbow), the style that became popular in Kamakura period.

sen.j: 多宝塔－鎌倉時代のもの。
sen.e: Tahodo pagoda – established in Kamakura period
Tahodo ('multi-treasure' pagoda) – constructed in Kamakura period
sen.cmt: 訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Tahodo ('multi-treasure' pagoda) – constructed in Kamakura period

sen.j: 「大和名所図絵」によれば、寛政年間には檜皮葺きの上層部があったが、明治に入ってからの廃仏毀釈の中で取り払われた。
sen.e: According to the 'Yamato meisho zue,' it had a top layer of Hiwadabuki (construction with the bark of hinoki, Japanese cypress) in Kansei era, but it was abandoned as a part of the Exclusion of Buddhism in Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to an old painting, 'Yamato meisho zue,' (Beauty spots in Yamato), the pagoda had a top layer of Hiwadabuki roofing (a style of roofing with the bark of hinoki, Japanese cypress) in Kansei era, but it was cast away during the movement of the Exclusion of Buddhism in Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: According to an old painting, 'Yamato meisho zue,' (Beauty spots in Yamato), the pagoda had a top layer of Hiwadabuki roofing (a style of roofing with the bark of hinoki, Japanese cypress) in Kansei era, but it was cast away during the movement of the Exclusion of Buddhism in Meiji period.

sen.j: 現在は第一層のみが残っている。
sen.e: Now only the first layer remains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Now only the first layer remains.
Now only the first layer remains.

sen.j: 文化財
sen.e: Cultural property
Cultural properties
Cultural properties

sen.j: 重要文化財
sen.e: Important Cultural Property
Important Cultural Properties
Important Cultural Properties

sen.j: 南門
sen.e: The south gate
The south gate
The south gate

sen.j: 本堂
sen.e: Hondo
Hondo
Hondo

sen.j: 多宝塔
sen.e: Tahodo pagoda
Tahodo
sen.cmt: 上記初出の表記に合わせました。
sen.e: Tahodo

sen.j: 木造聖観世音菩薩立像－寺伝に在原業平の作という。
sen.e: Wooden Shokannon Bosatsu Ryuzo (standing statue of Shokannon Bosatsu) – According to the temple legend, it was made by ARIWARA no Narihira.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Shokannon Bosatsu –According to the temple legend, the artist is attributed to ARIWARA no Narihira.
sen.cmt: 他の寺社仏閣の文化財表記に合わせました。
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Shokannon Bosatsu –According to the temple legend, the artist is attributed to ARIWARA no Narihira.

sen.j: しかし様式的には平安時代中期、11世紀頃の作と思われる。
sen.e: However, judging from the style, it is supposed that it was made in the middle of Heian period in around the 11th century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, judging from the style, it is supposed that it was made in the middle of Heian period in around the 11th century.
However, judging from the style, it is supposed that it was made in the middle of Heian period in around the 11th century.

sen.j: 一木彫で、胡粉地に極彩装飾を施す。
sen.e: It was carved of one tree, and richly colored decoration is painted on the whitewash base.
It was carved of one tree and worked with richly colored decoration on the whitewash base.
sen.cmt: tree and worked with richly colored decoration on
sen.e: It was carved of one tree and worked with richly colored decoration on the whitewash base.

sen.j: 本堂安置。
sen.e: It is settled in Hondo.
It is settled in Hondo.
It is settled in Hondo.

sen.j: 木造五大明王像－平安時代中期作。
sen.e: Wooden Godai Myo-O Zo (statue of Five Wisdom Kings) – It was made in the middle of Heian period.
Wooden statue of Godai Myoo (Five Kings of Wisdom) – made in the middle of Heian period.
sen.cmt: 他の寺社仏閣の文化財表記に合わせました。
sen.e: Wooden statue of Godai Myoo (Five Kings of Wisdom) – made in the middle of Heian period.

sen.j: 本堂安置。
sen.e: It is settled in Hondo.
It is settled in Hondo.
It is settled in Hondo.

sen.j: 舎利厨子－奈良国立博物館に寄託。
sen.e: Shari Zushi (The container to hold the urn putting in the Buddha's ashes) – It is deposited to the Nara National Museum.
Shari Zushi (miniature shrine to preserve Buddha's ashes) – deposited in the Nara National Museum.
sen.cmt: 他の寺社仏閣の文化財表記に合わせました。
sen.e: Shari Zushi (miniature shrine to preserve Buddha's ashes) – deposited in the Nara National Museum.

sen.j: 厨子内に安置されていた五輪塔形舎利容器は1952年に盗難に遭って行方不明である。
sen.e: The pagoda style container for Buddha's bones which had been in the Zushi was stolen in 1952, and has not been found until now.
The container for Buddha's relic of a five-storied pagoda shape placed in the Zushi was stolen in 1952, and since then it remains missing.
sen.cmt: 訳を一部修正しました。
sen.e: The container for Buddha's relic of a five-storied pagoda shape placed in the Zushi was stolen in 1952, and since then it remains missing.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Others

sen.j: 阿保親王坐像－奈良県指定文化財。
sen.e: Seated statue of the Imperial Prince Abo – Cultural properties designated by Nara Prefecture.
Seated statue of the Imperial Prince Abo – Cultural Property designated by Nara Prefecture.
Seated statue of the Imperial Prince Abo – Cultural Property designated by Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代作。
sen.e: It was made in Kamakura period.
It was made in Kamakura period.
It was made in Kamakura period.

sen.j: 石棺－5世紀のもの。
sen.e: The stone coffin – It was made in the 5th century.
Stone coffin – It was made in the 5th century.
Stone coffin – It was made in the 5th century.

sen.j: ウワナベ古墳付近にて発掘されたもの。
sen.e: It was excavated from the area around the Uwanabe Ancient Tomb.
It was excavated from the site around the Uwanabe Ancient Tomb.
It was excavated from the site around the Uwanabe Ancient Tomb.

sen.j: 庫裏北側に置かれている。
sen.e: It is settled in the north of Kuri (the priests' living quarters or the kitchen of a temple).
It is settled in the north of Kuri (the priests' living quarters or the kitchen of a temple).
It is settled in the north of Kuri (the priests' living quarters or the kitchen of a temple).

sen.j: JR関西本線奈良駅・近鉄奈良駅より奈良交通バス（西大寺駅・航空自衛隊行き）乗車。
sen.e: From Nara Station (JR Kansai Main Line/ Kintetsu Railway), take Nara Kotsu Bus bound for Saidai-ji Temple and Japan Air Self-Defense Force.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From Nara Station (JR Kansai Main Line/ Kintetsu Railway), take Nara Kotsu Bus bound for Saidai-ji Temple/Japan Air Self-Defense Force.
sen.cmt: 西大寺駅・航空自衛隊行きのナカグロ（・）は、JR関西本線奈良駅・近鉄奈良駅と同様スラッシュ（/）で対応しました。
sen.e: From Nara Station (JR Kansai Main Line/ Kintetsu Railway), take Nara Kotsu Bus bound for Saidai-ji Temple/Japan Air Self-Defense Force.

sen.j: 「一条高校前（不退寺口）」下車、徒歩7分
sen.e: Get off at 'Ichijo Koko Mae (Futai-ji Guchi)' and walk for about seven minutes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Get off at 'Ichijo Koko Mae (Futai-ji Guchi)' and walk for about seven minutes.
Get off at 'Ichijo Koko Mae (Futai-ji Guchi)' and walk for about seven minutes.

sen.j: 近畿日本鉄道大和西大寺駅より奈良交通バス（JR奈良駅・白土町行き）乗車。
sen.e: From Yamato Saidai-ji Station (Kintetsu Railway), take Nara Kotsu Bus bound for JR Nara Station and Shiratsuchi-cho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From Yamato Saidai-ji Station (Kintetsu Railway), take Nara Kotsu Bus bound for JR Nara Station/ Shiratsuchi-cho.
sen.cmt: ナカグロ（・）は、スラッシュ（/）で対応しました。
sen.e: From Yamato Saidai-ji Station (Kintetsu Railway), take Nara Kotsu Bus bound for JR Nara Station/ Shiratsuchi-cho.

sen.j: 「不退寺口」下車、徒歩7分
sen.e: Get off at 'Futai-ji Guchi' and walk for about seven minutes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Get off at 'Futai-ji Guchi' and walk for about seven minutes.
Get off at 'Futai-ji Guchi' and walk for about seven minutes.

sen.j: 拝観は午前9時～午後5時、拝観料は大人・中・高生500円、小学生300円。
sen.e: The opening hours are 9:00am – 5:00pm, and the entrance fee is 500 yen for adults, junior and senior high school students and 300 yen for elementary school students.
The opening hours are 9:00am – 5:00pm, and the entrance fee is 500 yen for adults, junior and senior high school students and 300 yen for elementary school students.
The opening hours are 9:00am – 5:00pm, and the entrance fee is 500 yen for adults, junior and senior high school students and 300 yen for elementary school students.
